other_tests.findings: Erythematous, granular, hemorrhagic, ulcerated mucosa in the proximal ascending colon and cecum, findings consistent with severe active colitis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressive worsening of clinical symptoms and progressive mucosal inflammation were noted.

other_tests.findings: Biopsy specimens of the ileum and ascending colon showed normal mucosa; a biopsy specimen of the cecum showed evidence of active chronic colitis consistent with Crohn’s disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The findings changed to show severe active colitis with marked ulceration in subsequent examinations.

other_tests.findings: Normal terminal ileum; inflammation primarily in the cecum.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The inflammation was later observed to have deep ulcerations in the right side of the colon upon follow-up.

other_tests.findings: Fecal calprotectin level was elevated (243 μg per gram initially, later 2144 μg per gram).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Elevated from 243 μg per gram to more than 3000 μg per gram.

other_tests.findings: Normal results, but gastric biopsy specimens showed evidence of Helicobacter pylori gastritis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The gastritis showed near resolution after treatment for H. pylori.

other_tests.findings: Thickening and enhancement of the ascending colon, cecum, and terminal ileum, consistent with inflammation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings were noted to have progressive worsening in follow-up imaging leading to surgery.

other_tests.findings: Examination of smears for acid-fast bacilli was negative; cultures of a paratracheal lymph node grew Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
